titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Greater New Haven Coalition for People Records
Greater New Haven Coalition for People Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Christy Tomecek

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 11:42

did.unittitle: Greater New Haven Coalition for People records

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection comprises records of the Greater New Haven Coalition for People, a grassroots organization that advocates for lower and middle income residents of New Haven, Connecticut. Materials include correspondence, financial and fundraising records, files on topics and events that the Coalition worked on, and posters and protest signs. Materials date from 1981 to 2014. Much of the collection concerns different issues the Coalition focused on, including the removal of bus stops from the City of New Haven, medical care for the low-income and uninsured in the local hospitals, conditions of public housing, and programs like the West Rock Youth Leadership Program and Tenants Against Drugs Dammit!

langmaterial.language: The material is in English and Spanish.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Greater New Haven Coalition for People

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged into the following series: I: Correspondence, 1992-2009. II: Financial and fundraising records, 1983-2011. III. Meeting agendas and minutes, 1988-2014. IV: Topical files, 1981-2010. V: Posters and protest signs, 1986-1990.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Greater New Haven Coalition for People Records (MS 2007). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to Yale University for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection whether such works are at Yale or physically located elsewhere in the world. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection comprises records of the Greater New Haven Coalition for People, a grassroots organization that advocates for lower and middle income residents of New Haven, Connecticut. Materials include correspondence, financial and fundraising records, files on topics and events that the Coalition worked on, and posters and protest signs. Materials date from 1981 to 2014. Much of the collection concerns different issues the Coalition focused on, including the removal of bus stops from the City of New Haven, medical care for the low-income and uninsured in the local hospitals, conditions of public housing, and programs like the West Rock Youth Leadership Program and Tenants Against Drugs Dammit!

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Greater New Haven Coalition for People, 2014.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Greater New Haven Coalition for People was founded in 1981 as an umbrella group of different community agencies and organizations that were concerned about the effect of budget cuts on programs in the city of New Haven, Connecticut. Soon it evolved into a grassroots organization run by a board of directors and work mainly undertaken by volunteers and some paid organizers that focused on organizing local residents. Coalition for People addresses a variety of issues that impact the low and middle income residents of New Haven, including conditions and safety of public housing, health care, public transit safety and availability, and programs for children and adolescents.

Local transit

controlaccess.corpname: Greater New Haven Coalition for People

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I comprises general correspondence sent by and to the Coalition for People. The major topics include the Coalition's financial difficulties in the 1990s, donations sent to the Coalition, and the resignation of a board member.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II contains annual and other financial reports, solicitation letters, grant descriptions and applications, and state and federal tax filings.

did.unittitle: Comprehensive Grant Program- annual statement submission

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III contains agendas and minutes from monthly meetings, annual meetings, board meetings, and conventions. Monthly meetings focused on the financial status of Coalition for People and projects that were in progess. Annual meetings focused on projects in progress, organization structure review and work towards new projects. Board meetings focused on the budget and direction of projects for Coalition for People. Conventions focused on action sessions for such interest areas as youth empowerment, public housing issues and health care. Conventions also provided resources for the New Haven community in the same interest areas.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Topical files cover a diverse range of subjects of interest to Coalition for People and events Coalition for People held and/or participated in. Also included with the topical files are materials related to three different major projects undertaken by the Coalition. These include stopping, then reversing the removal of bus stops by the City of New Haven after the city's agreement with the Omni Hotel; health care and health insurance initiatives to help lower income residents of New Haven; and the West Rock Youth Leadership Program, a summer program which provided children of that neighborhood classes, mentorships, and recreational opportunities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series V comprises posters and protest signs for various projects and causes. They are related to bus stop removal, conditions in public housing, and Tenants Against Drugs Dammit! (TADD). There are also posters with photographs from events and conventions held by the Coalition.
